He <st data-num="01961" class="">arrived</st> on the <st data-num="06218" class="">tenth</st> <st data-num="02320" class="">day</st> of the <st data-num="06224" class="">tenth</st> <st data-num="02320" class="">month</st> in the <st data-num="08671" class="">ninth</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">year</st> of Zedekiah’s <st data-num="04427" class="">reign</st>.<n id="2" />

The <st data-num="05892" class="">city</st> <st data-num="0935" class="">remained</st> under <st data-num="04692" class="">siege</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">until</st> <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="06667" class="">Zedekiah’s</st> <st data-num="06249 06240">eleventh</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">year</st>.

By the <st data-num="08672" class="">ninth</st> day of the fourth <st data-num="02320" class="">month</st><n id="1" /> the <st data-num="07458" class="">famine</st> in the <st data-num="05892" class="">city</st> <st data-num="02388" class="">was</st> so <st data-num="02388" class="">severe</st> the <st data-num="05971 0776">residents</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="01961" class="">had</st> <st data-num="03808" class="">no</st> <st data-num="03899" class="">food</st>.

The enemy <st data-num="01234" class="">broke through</st> the <st data-num="05892" class="">city</st> walls,<n id="1" /> and <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="0376 04421">soldiers</st> tried to escape. They left the city during the <st data-num="03915" class="">night</st>.<n id="2" /> They went <st data-num="01870" class="">through</st> the <st data-num="08179" class="">gate</st> <st data-num="0996" class="">between</st> the two <st data-num="02346" class="">walls</st>, <st data-num="0834" class="">which</st> is <st data-num="05921" class="">near</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king’s</st> <st data-num="01588" class="">garden</st>.<n id="3" /> (The <st data-num="03778" class="">Babylonians</st> were <st data-num="05439" class="">all</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">around</st> the <st data-num="05892" class="">city</st>.) Then they <st data-num="01980" class="">headed</st> <st data-num="01870" class="">for</st> the <st data-num="06160" class="">rift valley</st>.<n id="4" />

But the <st data-num="03778" class="">Babylonian</st> <st data-num="02428" class="">army</st> <st data-num="07291" class="">chased</st> <st data-num="0310" class="">after</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st>. They <st data-num="05381" class="">caught up with</st> him in the <st data-num="06160" class="">rift valley plains</st> of <st data-num="03405" class="">Jericho</st>,<n id="1" /> and his <st data-num="03605" class="">entire</st> <st data-num="02428" class="">army</st> <st data-num="06327 05921">deserted</st> him.

They <st data-num="08610" class="">captured</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> and <st data-num="05927" class="">brought</st> him <st data-num="05927" class="">up</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="0894" class="">Babylon</st> at <st data-num="07247" class="">Riblah</st>,<n id="1" /> where he<n id="2" /> <st data-num="01696" class="">passed</st> <st data-num="04941" class="">sentence</st> <st data-num="0854" class="">on</st> him.
Zedekiah’s sons were executed while Zedekiah was forced to watch. The king of Babylon then had Zedekiah’s eyes put out, bound him in bronze chains, and carried him off to Babylon.
On the seventh day of the fifth month, in the nineteenth year of King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon, Nebuzaradan, the captain of the royal guard, who served the king of Babylon, arrived in Jerusalem.
He burned down the Lord’s temple, the royal palace, and all the houses in Jerusalem, including every large house.

The <st data-num="03605" class="">whole</st> <st data-num="03778" class="">Babylonian</st> <st data-num="02428" class="">army</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> came with the <st data-num="07227" class="">captain</st> of the <st data-num="02876" class="">royal guard</st> <st data-num="05422" class="">tore down</st> the <st data-num="02346" class="">walls</st> that <st data-num="05439" class="">surrounded</st> <st data-num="03389" class="">Jerusalem</st>.

<st data-num="05018" class="">Nebuzaradan</st>, the <st data-num="07227" class="">captain</st> of the <st data-num="02876" class="">royal guard</st>, <st data-num="01540" class="">deported</st> the <st data-num="03499" class="">rest</st> of the <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st> who were <st data-num="07604" class="">left</st> in the <st data-num="05892" class="">city</st>, <st data-num="05307" class="">those</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">who</st> had <st data-num="05307" class="">deserted</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="0894" class="">Babylon</st>, and the <st data-num="03499" class="">rest</st> of the <st data-num="0527" class="">craftsmen</st>.<n id="1" />
But he left behind some of the poor of the land and gave them fields and vineyards.
The Babylonians broke the two bronze pillars in the Lord’s temple, as well as the movable stands and the big bronze basin called “The Sea.” They took the bronze to Babylon.

They also <st data-num="03947" class="">took</st> the <st data-num="05518" class="">pots</st>, <st data-num="03257" class="">shovels</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="04212" class="">trimming shears</st>,<n id="2" /> <st data-num="03709" class="">pans</st>, and <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="05178" class="">bronze</st> <st data-num="03627" class="">utensils</st> <st data-num="0834 08334">used</st> by the priests.<n id="3" />

The <st data-num="07227" class="">captain</st> of the <st data-num="02876" class="">royal guard</st> <st data-num="03947" class="">took</st> the <st data-num="0834 02091 02091">golden</st> and <st data-num="0834 03701 03701">silver</st> <st data-num="04289" class="">censers</st><n id="1" /> and <st data-num="04219" class="">basins</st>.

The bronze of the items that King Solomon made for the Lord’s temple—including the two pillars, the big bronze basin called “The Sea,” the twelve bronze bulls under “The Sea,” and the movable stands—was too heavy to be weighed.

Each of the pillars was about 27 feet high. The bronze top of one pillar was about 4½ feet high and had bronze latticework and pomegranate-shaped ornaments all around it. The second pillar with its latticework was like it.
The captain of the royal guard took Seraiah, the chief priest, and Zephaniah, the priest who was second in rank, and the three doorkeepers.

<st data-num="04480" class="">From</st> the <st data-num="05892" class="">city</st> he <st data-num="03947" class="">took</st> <st data-num="0259" class="">a</st> <st data-num="05631" class="">eunuch</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">who</st> <st data-num="01931">was</st> <st data-num="06496" class="">in charge</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">of</st> the <st data-num="0376 04421">soldiers</st>, <st data-num="02568" class="">five</st><n id="1" /> of the <st data-num="04428" class="">king’s</st> <st data-num="0376 07200 06440">advisers</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="0834" class="">who</st> were <st data-num="04672" class="">discovered</st> in the <st data-num="05892" class="">city</st>, an <st data-num="08269" class="">official</st> <st data-num="06635" class="">army</st> <st data-num="05608" class="">secretary</st> who <st data-num="06633" class="">drafted</st> <st data-num="05971 0776">citizens</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="06633" class="">for military service</st>, and <st data-num="08346" class="">60</st> <st data-num="0376" class="">citizens</st> from the <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st> of the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> who were <st data-num="04672" class="">discovered</st> in the <st data-num="05892" class="">city</st>.

<st data-num="05018" class="">Nebuzaradan</st>, <st data-num="07227" class="">captain</st> of the <st data-num="02876" class="">royal guard</st>, <st data-num="03947" class="">took</st> them and <st data-num="01980" class="">brought</st> them <st data-num="05921" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="0894" class="">Babylon</st> at <st data-num="07247" class="">Riblah</st>.
The king of Babylon ordered them to be executed at Riblah in the territory of Hamath. So Judah was deported from its land.
Now King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon appointed Gedaliah son of Ahikam, son of Shaphan, as governor over the people whom he allowed to remain in the land of Judah.

<st data-num="03605" class="">All</st> the <st data-num="08269" class="">officers</st> of the Judahite <st data-num="02428" class="">army</st><n id="1" /> and <st data-num="01992" class="">their</st> <st data-num="0376" class="">troops</st> <st data-num="08085" class="">heard</st> <st data-num="03588" class="">that</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="0894" class="">Babylon</st> had <st data-num="06485" class="">appointed</st> <st data-num="01436" class="">Gedaliah</st> <st data-num="06485" class="">to govern</st>. So they <st data-num="0935" class="">came</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="01436" class="">Gedaliah</st> at <st data-num="04709" class="">Mizpah</st>. The <st data-num="01992 0376">officers who came</st> were <st data-num="03458" class="">Ishmael</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="05418" class="">Nethaniah</st>, <st data-num="03110" class="">Johanan</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="07143" class="">Kareah</st>, <st data-num="08304" class="">Seraiah</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="08576" class="">Tanhumeth</st> the <st data-num="05200" class="">Netophathite</st>, and <st data-num="02970" class="">Jaazaniah</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of the <st data-num="04602" class="">Maacathite</st>.

<st data-num="01436" class="">Gedaliah</st> <st data-num="07650" class="">took an oath</st> so as to give them and their <st data-num="0376" class="">troops</st> some assurance of safety.<n id="1" /> He <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “You <st data-num="0408" class="">don’t</st> need to <st data-num="03372" class="">be afraid</st> to submit to the <st data-num="03778" class="">Babylonian</st> <st data-num="05650" class="">officials</st>. <st data-num="03427" class="">Settle down</st> in the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> and <st data-num="05647" class="">submit to</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="0894" class="">Babylon</st>. Then things will <st data-num="03190" class="">go well</st> for you.”

<st data-num="01961" class="">But</st> in the <st data-num="07637" class="">seventh</st> <st data-num="02320" class="">month</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="03458" class="">Ishmael</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="05418" class="">Nethaniah</st>, <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="0476" class="">Elishama</st>, who was a <st data-num="02233" class="">member</st> of the <st data-num="04410" class="">royal family</st>,<n id="2" /> <st data-num="0935" class="">came</st> <st data-num="0854" class="">with</st> <st data-num="06235" class="">10</st> of his <st data-num="0376" class="">men</st> and <st data-num="05221 04191">murdered</st> <st data-num="01436" class="">Gedaliah</st>,<n id="3" /> as well as the <st data-num="03064" class="">Judeans</st> and <st data-num="03778" class="">Babylonians</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">who</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">were</st> <st data-num="0854" class="">with</st> him at <st data-num="04709" class="">Mizpah</st>.
Then all the people, from the youngest to the oldest, as well as the army officers, left for Egypt, because they were afraid of what the Babylonians might do.

In the thirty-seventh year of the exile of King Jehoiachin of Judah, on the twenty-seventh day of the twelfth month, King Evil Merodach of Babylon, in the first year of his reign, pardoned King Jehoiachin of Judah and released him from prison.

He <st data-num="01696" class="">spoke</st> <st data-num="02896" class="">kindly</st> <st data-num="0854" class="">to</st> him and <st data-num="05414" class="">gave</st> him a <st data-num="05921" class="">more prestigious</st> <st data-num="03678" class="">position</st> <st data-num="03678" class="">than</st><n id="1" /> the other <st data-num="04428" class="">kings</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">who</st> were <st data-num="0854" class="">with</st> him in <st data-num="0894" class="">Babylon</st>.

Jehoiachin<n id="1" /> <st data-num="08132" class="">took off</st> his <st data-num="03608" class="">prison</st> <st data-num="0899" class="">clothes</st> and <st data-num="0398 03899">ate</st> <st data-num="08548" class="">daily</st> in the king’s <st data-num="06440" class="">presence</st> for the <st data-num="03605 03117">rest</st> of his <st data-num="02416" class="">life</st>.
He was given daily provisions by the king for the rest of his life until the day he died.
